seg.translation: North Sea oil field workers end strike, negotiations continue

seg.source: 首席谈判代表表示，北海油田的工人停止了关于薪酬的罢工，此次纠纷的各方开始了新一轮的谈判。
seg.translation: The chief negotiations representative expressed that the North Sea Oil workers have stopped strikes regarding employee pay. Both parties have initiated a new round of negotiations for this dispute.
The chief negotiator said workers at the North Sea oil field had halted the pay strike, and the parties to the dispute began a new round of negotiations.
The chief negotiator said workers at North Sea oil fields had halted strikes over pay and the parties to the dispute had begun a new round of negotiations.

seg.source: 荷兰皇家壳牌经营的北海石油平台上出现了多次针对油田服务公司 Wood Group 的罢工。
seg.translation: The North Sea oil platform operated by the Royal Dutch Shell has experienced multiple strikes directed against the oil field service company Wood Group.
A number of strikes against Wood Group, the Oil-field Service company, have appeared on the North Sea oil platform operated by Royal Dutch Shell.
There have been a number of strikes against oil field services company Wood Group on North Sea oil platforms operated by Royal Dutch Shell.

seg.source: 根据一份联合声明，“Wood Group 以及 Unite 和 RMT 工会可以确认我们已同意重启当前纠纷的解决进程。”
seg.translation: According to a joint statement, “Wood Group, Unite, and RMT unions can verify that we have agreed to restart the process to address the current dispute.”

seg.source: 我们将从下周早些时候开始，在未来几周举行多场全天会议，重新审视这些问题。
seg.translation: We will start earlier from next week onward. In the next few weeks, multiple full-day conferences will be held. These issues will be re-examined.
We will revisit these issues from the beginning of next week with a number of all-day meetings in the coming weeks.

seg.source: 工会表示其近期采取的行动是为了抗议最高可能达到30%的减薪，而这也是工会25年以来首次采取这一行动。
seg.translation: The union expressed that actions taken recently is to protest salary reduction that may reach as high as 30%. This is the first time in 25 years that the union has taken such an act.
The union said it had recently taken action to protest the highest possible pay cut of 30% per cent, which was the first by the Union since 25.
The union said its recent action, the first of its kind in 25 years, was in protest at a possible pay cut of up to 30 per cent.

seg.source: Wood Group 今年因市场压力而将北海承包商的报酬降低了约9%。
seg.translation: Wood Group lowered the compensation of North Sea contractors by about 9% this year because of market pressure.
Wood Group has reduced the compensation for North Sea contractors by about 9% this year due to market pressure.
Wood Group has reduced compensation for North Sea contractors by about 9 per cent this year because of market pressures.

seg.source: 此次减薪前，该公司在2014年将海上承包商的报酬降低了10%。
seg.translation: Prior to this salary reduction, this company has reduced remuneration paid for overseas contractors by 10%.
Prior to the pay cut, the company lowered its offshore contractor's pay by 10% in 2014.
The pay cut comes after the company cut compensation for offshore contractors by 10 per cent in 2014.

seg.source: 公司表示，再次减薪将帮助公司度过市场萧条的难关。
seg.translation: The company said that another salary cut would help tide the company over the market downturn.
The company said another pay cut would help the company tide over the market depression.
The company said another pay cut would help the company ride out the market slump.

seg.source: 壳牌已裁减了数千名员工并且宣布计划关停10个国家的油气设备，这是因为公司在与英国能源公司英国天然气集团合并后需要精简其业务。
seg.translation: Shell has laid off thousands of workers and announced that it will be shutting down oil and gas facilities and plants in 10 countries. This is because Shell is required to streamline its businesses after its merger with British Gas.

Shell has cut thousands of of its staff and announced plans to shut down 10 of its oil and gas facilities because it needs to streamline its operations after it merged with British Gas group, a UK energy company.

seg.source: 能源公司正在面临来自原油价格下降以及英国六月脱欧决定的压力。
seg.translation: Energy companies are facing pressure from declining crude oil prices and the Brexit decision in June.

seg.source: 苏格兰议会成员戴夫·安德森在本周早些时候与工会领导人会面，共同探讨北海这一代人最大的劳动纠纷。
seg.translation: David Anderson, a member of the Scottish Parliament, said earlier this week that he met with union leaders to investigate the biggest North Sea labor dispute in this generation.

seg.translation: In this statement, Dave expressed: “In the North Sea and for the entire country, we need an economy that serves the majority, and not the minority.”

seg.translation: In 2016, expenditure for new North Sea projects are not expected to exceed US$1.4 billion. In the last five years, the average project expenditure was approximately US$7 billion.
